evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Alex discussed their fear of freezing up in social situations, particularly when networking for internships or leading student groups. Solutions offered included the 3-Question Rule, Active Listening Focus, and 5-Second Reset techniques, as well as structured question preparation (specialized and bridge questions) and the ARE method for follow-ups. Alex responded positively, practicing role-playing scenarios and showing relief in having a concrete plan. Evidence of progress includes successfully refining questions, using the ARE method, and demonstrating increased confidence in handling specific and unfamiliar topics during practice.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Alex discussed freezing during networking for museum internships. Solutions offered included the 3-Question Rule, 5-Second Reset, ARE method, and 90-second timing strategy. Alex responded positively, practicing immediately with roleplays for both historical and contemporary museum scenarios. Evidence of progress includes developing tiered questions, successfully implementing the ARE method, and self-correcting when becoming too technical. The session concluded with timed practice using the 90-second rule, which Alex initially rushed but quickly adapted to.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Alex expressed fear about networking at museum internship career fairs and freezing during conversations. The coach provided concrete strategies: 1) 3-Question Rule for preparation, 2) ARE method for conversation flow, 3) 5-Second Reset for awkward moments, and 4) 90-second rule for time management. Alex responded positively, practicing these techniques in roleplays for different museum types (natural history and contemporary art). Evidence of progress includes: successfully implementing the ARE method, developing specialized questions, practicing timed interactions, and demonstrating improved self-awareness by recognizing and adjusting overly technical questions. Alex showed measurable reduction in anxiety through the session.
